moves.1. f4: This is from a tournament game that went pretty well for me
moves.1... e5: Starting point of the tournament, this is the Bird, From gambit
moves.2. fxe5 Nc6 3. Nc3: I played this move for variety really, my natural instinct would be more towards protecting the pawn, possibly with d4
moves.3... Nxe5 4. d4 Ng6 5. e4 d6: While I am sure its valid I don't like this move from black, it blocks his dsb, I guess with the intention of c5
moves.6. Bc4 c6: I don't understand this move, it seems to me to waste a tempo when black is already behind in development
moves.7. Nf3 h6 8. Be3: I think looking at it now I might have been better to fianchetto this bishop
moves.8... Nf6 9. Qe2: My intention here was to line my queen up with the black king
moves.9... Be7 10. O-O-O Bg4: I think if I were black I would have castled here, this move allows me to start pushing my pawns forward.
moves.11. h3 Bd7 12. e5: I'm looking to prevent black from castling
moves.12... dxe5 13. dxe5: Black suddenly looks a little cramped
moves.14... fxe6 15. Bxe6 Nhf8: now blacks king is surrounded I want to get my bishop or my queen onto the h5-e8 diagonal, though the knights could be a nuisance
moves.16. Bb3: Although this move may not seem the best, the bishop did not move for the rest of the game and proved influential at the end
moves.16... Qc7 17. Qc4: threatening Qf7 though of course black can castle, if he does then I have Bxa7 and nc5 at my disposal
moves.18... Qg3: I think this is a mistake from black as it takes his queen away from the defence of his king, though he has few options for his queen
moves.19... Bg5+: Again I am not sure how much this achieves as it takes another defender away from the black king, I can pin the lsb to the king with Rh-e1
moves.20. Kb1 cxd5 21. Qb5+: I played this in preference to Ba4+ as it keeps open the option of Bxd5
moves.21... Bd7 22. Qxb7: Possibly not the best, Rh-e1+ might have been better
moves.22... Qxf2: Although black is ahead on material his position doesn't look that good to me
moves.23. Rhe1+ Ne6 24. Qxa8+ Ke7 25. Qxd5 Rd8:
Black resigned.

thanks for reading please comment
